snippet.title: Comprehensive Cancer Information \- BRCA1 and BRCA2 - Cancer Risk and Genetic Testing Fact Sheet - National Cancer Institute
snippet.description: Together, BRCA1 and BRCA 2 mutations account for about 20 to 25 percent of hereditary breast cancers (1) and about 5 to 10 percent of all breast cancers (2). Breast cancers associated with BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations tend to develop at younger ages than sporadic breast cancers.

snippet.title: Breast Cancer Symptoms, Signs, Stages, Prevention, Detection, Facts, Treatment - OnHealth
snippet.description: What follows is a review of information on breast cancer intended to aid patients and their families in their navigation through the vast ocean of breast cancer information and issues. Breast cancer is diagnosed with physician and self-examination of the breasts, mammography, ultrasound testing, and biopsy.

snippet.title: Breast Cancer Health Center - Lobular Carcinoma (Invasive and In Situ)
snippet.description: While the majority of breast cancers start in the ducts of the breasts, some breast cancers begin in the lobules. The majority of breast cancers start in the ducts of the breasts. The majority of these later cancers begin in the milk ducts, rather than the lobules and both breasts may be involved.
